description: The process of political communication has been undergoing transformation across the world through the rise of digital media. The transformation is also the result of the way established institutions, including political parties and news organisation, have changed, and the ways citizens are engaging with politics and news media. The module is designed to introduce students to the most important and up-to-date empirical and theoretical work in field of political communication â€“ an interdisciplinary field of study. The course will help develop a stronger conceptual understanding of contemporary political communication processes and enable you to conduct independent analysis of current issues.
